00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
00003 
00004 import frameworkBase
00005 import sys
00006 
00007 ## \brief Framework for static models
00008 #
00009 class StaticFramework(frameworkBase.FrameworkBase):
00010   ## \brief Constructor
00011   #
00012   # \param userModel object containing the user model class
00013   def __init__(self, userModel):
00014     frameworkBase.FrameworkBase.__init__(self)
00015     self._d_model = userModel
00016     self._testRequirements()
00017 
00018     self._addMethodToClass(self._readmapNew)
00019     self._addMethodToClass(self._reportNew)
00020 
00021 
00022   ## \brief Re-implemented from ShellScript.
00023   #
00024   # Runs the execute or initial section of the user model.
00025   def run(self):
00026     self._atStartOfScript()
00027     # Execute initial section.
00028     self._runInitial()
00029 
00030     return 0
00031 
00032 
00033   ## \brief Returns the class provided by the user
00034   def _userModel(self):
00035     return self._d_model
00036 
00037 
00038 
00039   ## \brief Testing the requirements for the static framework
00040   #
00041   # To use the static framework the user must implement:
00042   # - either a run or an initial method
00043   def _testRequirements(self):
00044     if hasattr(self._userModel(), "_userModel"):
00045       msg = "The _userModel method is deprecated and obsolete"
00046       self.showWarning(msg)
00047 
00048     if not hasattr(self._userModel(), "initial")\
00049       and not hasattr(self._userModel(), "run"):
00050       msg = "Cannot run static framework: Implement either an initial or a run method in the user class"
00051       raise frameworkBase.FrameworkError(msg)
00052
